name: apotropaic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
believed to protect against evil or bad luck: The wall of the cave was covered in apotropaic marks.
More examplesFewer examplesThe double-bladed axe was used throughout the Mycenaean world as an apotropaic symbol.Storytelling is one of our oldest apotropaic rituals; we hope to banish our fears by exposing them.It is often assumed that any representation of a serpent is apotropaic - that is, it is intended to ward off evil.The practice of calling on the moon goddess was exclusively carried out by women and had an apotropaic function.
